Class MainGraphicalInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • MainGraphicalInterface

  • public class MainGraphicalInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Bao Tran This is the user graphical interface with functions and references to the other classes This class allow the user to add information and see information

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MainGraphicalInterface()
      Constructor of this class

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAssignment(int index)
      Prompt the user to enter information on the assignment
      void addAssignmentActions()
      Go to addAssignment method to perform the necessary functions Then display updated information
      void addClass()
      Prompt the user for inputs to set the professor's info, textbook's info, and assignment's percentages
      void addClassActions()
      Go to the addClass() method to perform the necessary functions Then display the information that was just created
      void addProfileActions()
      Prompt to collect username, password, student id, and full name Password is implemented with a minimum length restriction in order to make the account a little more secure
      void addSemesterActions()
      Semesters are limited to only 2 per year Prompt for input then set that semester object that just had been created to thisSemester Then for convenience, prompt the user to add classes if they'd like
      void addYearActions()
      Check for valid year title, it must match the format provided Once all the data checks are through, set the Year object to the object that had just been created Then change the frame title to that title
      void detailsDisplay(int index)
      Push information onto the text areas to show assignments, professor info, and textbook info
      void display()
      Show the available courses along with it's letter grades, and number grades
      void editAssignmentActions()
      Pull the previously saved information of the assignment Display them into the present text fields
      void editClassActions()
      Set the previously stored information into the present fields Allow the user to alter the information present in those fields
      void informationActions()
      Set the available information into the text areas If there are more than two semesters, both text areas will contain that semester's information
      void loadAccounts()
      Load whatever is in the Accounts.txt file The reader looks for any matching tags and scan in it's values A tag with more than 1 values are separated by a "|" Each sections are separated using the .split() function Then those sections are passed into methods by it's index within the section's array
      void loadSemesterActions()
      Load all the available semesters into a combo box Then Prompt the user to select one to load Then set the thisSemester object to the found semester object Refresh the displays Add all the courses available within that semester into the main combo box
      void loadYearActions()
      First add all the available years into a combo box to select from Then locate the selected year by the index and set the Year object to the found object Then prompt to load or create a new semester
      void loginActions()
      Login functions, find matching password and username Then flush old information if available Limit the incorrect attempt to login to 5, if exceed that limit, the program will terminate
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      The program starts from here
      javax.swing.JPanel percentPanel()
      A panel that would allow the user to select a certain percentage for each course There are 5 drop downs each with numbers from 0 to 100 in multiples of 5
      void removeAssignmentActions()
      Add all the available assignments' names into a drop down box Then prompt the user to select an assignment to remove Then remove the assignment based on it's index Then refresh the displays, and re-save
      void removeCourseActions()
      Find the index of the selected course based on it's name Prompt the user to confirm the removal Then the course based on the index Refresh the display, and re-save
      void removeSemesterActions()
      Prompt the user to pick a semester from the list Then remove that selected semester based on it's index Then clear everything and re-save
      void save()
      Access the method to save any information within each class that are available
      void updateAssignmentActions()
      Update the assignment with the newly edited information
      void updateClassActions()
      Check if every edits are done correctly Check that the percentages adds up to 100 If it does, update the class with new information

        public void loginActions()
        Login functions, find matching password and username Then flush old information if available Limit the incorrect attempt to login to 5, if exceed that limit, the program will terminate

        Prompt to collect username, password, student id, and full name Password is implemented with a minimum length restriction in order to make the account a little more secure

        public void addYearActions()
        Check for valid year title, it must match the format provided Once all the data checks are through, set the Year object to the object that had just been created Then change the frame title to that title

      • addSemesterActions

        public void addSemesterActions()
        Semesters are limited to only 2 per year Prompt for input then set that semester object that just had been created to thisSemester Then for convenience, prompt the user to add classes if they'd like

      • removeCourseActions

        public void removeCourseActions()
        Find the index of the selected course based on it's name Prompt the user to confirm the removal Then the course based on the index Refresh the display, and re-save

      • removeAssignmentActions

        public void removeAssignmentActions()
        Add all the available assignments' names into a drop down box Then prompt the user to select an assignment to remove Then remove the assignment based on it's index Then refresh the displays, and re-save

        public void loadYearActions()
        First add all the available years into a combo box to select from Then locate the selected year by the index and set the Year object to the found object Then prompt to load or create a new semester

        public void loadSemesterActions()
        Load all the available semesters into a combo box Then Prompt the user to select one to load Then set the thisSemester object to the found semester object Refresh the displays Add all the courses available within that semester into the main combo box

      • informationActions

        public void informationActions()
        Set the available information into the text areas If there are more than two semesters, both text areas will contain that semester's information

        Access the method to save any information within each class that are available

      • loadAccounts

        public void loadAccounts()
        Load whatever is in the Accounts.txt file The reader looks for any matching tags and scan in it's values A tag with more than 1 values are separated by a "|" Each sections are separated using the .split() function Then those sections are passed into methods by it's index within the section's array

      • updateClassActions

        public void updateClassActions()
        Check if every edits are done correctly Check that the percentages adds up to 100 If it does, update the class with new information

      • percentPanel

        public javax.swing.JPanel percentPanel()
        A panel that would allow the user to select a certain percentage for each course There are 5 drop downs each with numbers from 0 to 100 in multiples of 5
        Returns:
        a panel where the user can select the percentages from 5 different types of assignments
